body.p: TIps for Gardners Flowers for a purpose Gardners want flowers for house bouquets, for beautification of the yard, or both. To be certain of an abundance of flowers for catting throughout the growing months, however, the gardener need plant packets of only three or four of too following flowers: Annuals—snapdragon, aster, ca- lendula, calliopais, candytuft, Carnation, bachelor button, cosmos, dahlia, larkspur, annual lupin, marigold, nasturtium, saipiglossiil and zinnia. Perennials—columbine, coreop- sis, gaiilardia grandiflora, peren- nial lupin, pyre brum (painted daisy) shasta daisy and delphini- um. For earliest bloom, the follow- ing are recommended by Gilbert Bentley, flower expert; Caiiiopgfs and candytuft among the annuals, and ccreopsis, delphinium and pyrethrum among the perennials. For late-blooming cut flowers, grow zinnia, marigold, gaiilardia, snapdragon, aster, cosmos and dahlia.
